Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: eson_pson
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, on a quiet street but still with hundreds of restaurants (and shops) on walking distance (Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona, Trastevere). Breakfast is outstanding and much better than normal hotels in Rome. Lots of cut fresh fruit, cheese and cold cuts, cereals, youghurts, bread, croissants, pastries and much more. Staff in breakfast room is very nice and you hardly notice them but they work extremely efficient and quiet. Reception staff is very pleasant and helpful, especially Irene who helped us a lot and always with a warm smile. Our room was small but clean. Would have appreciated two chairs (now one of us had to sit on the bed). Bedside lamp does not give efficient light for reading. Pillows are very hard.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Great location, two minute walk from campo di fiori. Right in the center of all the major attractions.The room was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was excellent in terms of choice and quantity and availability. No free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good rapport qualite/prix for the position.”
Reviews.Author: peter_miles
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the Albergo al Bischione nearby; this hotel was a little cheaper and, frankly, better. A decent breakfast is included and they take credit cards: Bischione does neither. The position is excellent in terms of tourist attractions and my room was quiet (having requested that in advance). And it is fun (for a Brit) to have the French Embassy next door so that whenever one felt a bit depressed there was a reminder that there is always someone further down the scale. So nothing really special but clean and decent - at a reasonable price in central Rome terms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Dallas51
Reviews.Content: This is a very quaint hotel down a small street right off Piazza Farnese and just a 2 or 3 minute walk to Campo dei Fiori, which is great plaza with some good restaurants and lots of activity. The breakfast buffet is wonderful...lots of fresh fruits, tomatoes, meats, cheese,etc. Every morning there was something different on the buffet. The rooms are spacious and very quaint. Biggest disappointment was the uncertainty of the internet. There is only one terminal and the internet is very, very slow....only negative to this review. If you do not need access to the internet then this is the place. Would definitely stay here again due to location.

Reviews.Title: “One of Rome' s best Locations”
Reviews.Author: PozzoDuesseldorf
Reviews.Content: A very nice, small hotel in one of Rome' s best Locations, hidden in an ancient building, full of charme; you can reach most of the major attractions (i e. Campo dei Fiori, Piazza Navona, St. Peter' s church) on foot. Some interesting restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: harry d
Reviews.Content: This small 31 room hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to most all major attractions. The staff was superb and the buffet breakfast was superior. Room was typical in size to most older European hotels but more than sufficient for our needs. Irene and Francesca at the desk were extremely helpful and much friendlier than most hotel front desk personnel I have encountered.. I would highly recommend this property and would not hesitate to stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Residenza Farnese
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Mascherone 59, Rome, Italy
